meanings.definition: The underside of a person's foot.
meanings.sent1: She felt the sand under her sole as she walked along the beach.
meanings.sent2: He had a pebble stuck in his sole, making it uncomfortable to walk.
meanings.sent3: The ticklish sensation on her sole made her giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His sole was as tough as leather after years of walking barefoot.
meanings.sent5: The doctor examined the sole of his foot to check for any injuries.

meanings.definition: The bottom of a shoe or boot.
meanings.sent1: The muddy sole of his boot left prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design on the sole of her new sneakers.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally stepped on gum, and now the sole of his shoe was sticky.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out sole of his work boots told the story of his hard labor.
meanings.sent5: The sole of her shoe squeaked on the polished floor with each step.

meanings.definition: The only one of its kind.
meanings.sent1: The rare flower was the sole beauty in the otherwise barren field.
meanings.sent2: His antique watch was the sole remaining item from his grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The sole survivor of the shipwreck was finally rescued after days at sea.
meanings.sent4: The sole purpose of the meeting was to discuss the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was the sole masterpiece in the gallery.

meanings.definition: To put a new sole on a shoe.
meanings.sent1: He needed to sole his favorite pair of boots before the hiking trip.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to sole shoes from her grandmother, who was a cobbler.
meanings.sent3: The cobbler promised to sole his worn-out shoes in time for the wedding.
meanings.sent4: After years of use, it was time to sole his trusty old sneakers.
meanings.sent5: The shoemaker carefully measured the foot to sole the shoe perfectly.
